section.title: Create a New Project
section.para: To start using OmegaT, you first have to create a project to hold all your files, such as your source files, translation memories, glossaries, and eventually your translated files. To create a new project, use , select a folder, and type a name for your project.

note.para: Since an OmegaT project is simply a set of folders and subfolders, you are entering the name of the folder that will hold your project. Alternatively, you can choose an existing empty folder created beforehand. Keep in mind that OmegaT cannot create a project in a folder that already contains files or subfolders.

section.para: If you don't remember where your project is, you can use .

The Create New Project dialog opens after you have named your project. The dialog is identical to the dialog that you access with . At the top of that dialog, select the languages of your source and translated files, and click the OK button to continue.
Once you have created the project, you can return to this dialog at any time by using .

note.para: The structure of a project can be modified at any moment during translation. You can point at new resource folders from that dialog and OmegaT will just ask you to reload the project to take the new locations into account.

section.para: Click on or and select your source files. OmegaT will then copy the selected files to the folder of your newly created project. You can close the dialog after the source files have loaded in the pane.
